ArticleTitle.sentence: Negative transcriptional regulation of human interleukin 2 (IL-2) gene by glucocorticoids through interference with nuclear transcription factors AP-1 and NF-AT.

AbstractText.sentence: IL-2 gene transcription is affected by several nuclear proteins.

AbstractText.sentence: We asked whether dexamethasone (Dex) and cyclosporin A (CsA) inhibit IL-2 gene transcription by interfering with the activity of nuclear proteins that bind to the IL-2 promoter.

event.clue: We asked whether dexamethasone (Dex) and cyclosporin A (CsA) inhibit IL-2 gene transcription by interfering with the activity of nuclear proteins that bind to the IL-2 promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: Nuclear extracts from primary human T lymphocytes were analyzed by electrophoretic DNA mobility shift assays.
Both Dex and CsA inhibited the binding of transcription factors AP-1 and NF-AT, but not of NF-kB and OCT-1/OAF, to their corresponding sites on the IL-2 gene promoter.

AbstractText.sentence: To correlate changes in nuclear factor binding in vitro with transcriptional activity in vivo and define the structural requirements for IL-2 promoter repression, we used transient DNA transfections.

AbstractText.sentence: Jurkat cells were transfected with plasmids containing either the intact IL-2 promoter or its AP-1, NF-AT, and NF-kB motifs.
Dex inhibited the IL-2 promoter and the AP-1, but not the NF-AT and NF-kB plasmids.
